_description: Accumulated wisdom for the Crypto Options / Volatility project (Deribit)

variance_risk_premium.summary: Crypto IV consistently overstates future realized vol by 5-15 vol points (VRP). This is the most robust and well-documented edge in options markets.
variance_risk_premium.evidence: Empirical across all option markets (equities, rates, FX, crypto). Crypto VRP larger than equities due to tail risk demand.
variance_risk_premium.signal: VRP = IV_atm - RV_realized_21d. Positive = IV expensive. Short vol when VRP > 3-5 vol points.
variance_risk_premium.risk: Rare but violent vol spikes (BTC crash Mar 2020, May 2021, Nov 2022) can wipe 30-50% in single events. Requires strict sizing.

skew.summary: 25-delta put skew measures crash risk premium. In crypto, skew can spike 20+ vol points during panic.
skew.signal: Skew z-score vs 30d mean. Fade extremes: high skew spike = puts too expensive = sell protection.

term_structure.summary: Front-month IV vs back-month IV. Normal: slight contango. Stress: steep inversion (front >>> back).
term_structure.signal: Term spread z-score. Sell front when steep (contango extreme). Buy when inverted.

implementation_notes.data_strategy: Deribit REST API for underlying prices. Synthetic IV generated from realized vol + calibrated VRP (AR(1) process). Use real IV from API when live.
implementation_notes.backtest_approach: Delta-equivalent weights on underlying (simplified). True options PnL requires Greeks P&L attribution (future work).
implementation_notes.cost_model: Deribit taker: 5 bps on underlying notional. With hedge cost ~7.5 bps total. Realistic cost: 10-15 bps round-trip.
implementation_notes.universe: BTC + ETH only. Options liquidity thin beyond top 2. Expand to SOL only if proven.
